comments:
I was trying to play with the new column feature... :)

I had show column on, and my testcase has a huge array as variable.
When I expanded a node, I got the following exception.

java.lang.ClassCastException: org/eclipse/debug/internal/ui/views/variables/IndexedValuePartition incompatible with org/eclipse/jdt/debug/core/IJavaValue
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.Throwable.<init>(Throwable.java)
	at java.lang.ClassCastException.<init>(ClassCastException.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.variables.JavaVariableLabelAdapter.getValueText(JavaVariableLabelAdapter.java:36)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.elements.adapters.VariableLabelAdapter.getColumnText(VariableLabelAdapter.java:68)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.elements.adapters.VariableLabelAdapter.getLabels(VariableLabelAdapter.java)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AsynchronousLabelAdapter.computeLabels(AsynchronousLabelAdapter.java:79)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.elements.adapters.AsynchronousDebugLabelAdapter.computeLabels(AsynchronousDebugLabelAdapter.java)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AsynchronousLabelAdapter$2.run(AsynchronousLabelAdapter.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java)
Please verify, Sam. Fix is to defer to super when not a java value

No more classcast exception, but NPE when trying to expand a partitioned variables:

Fixed - I refactored the column editing after te original fix...and did not test again. Oops.
